page.title: 07LITTLE HOUGHTON ..the past.
page.content: In{1086}the waters of the River Nene turned the paddles of the Clifford Hill Mill to the North of the village grinding corn. Its importance was emphasised by the fact that{William {the Conqueror}erected a motte and bailey close by. The mound then passed into private ownership when it was lowered and levelled; the owner wanted to turn it into a bowling green!{John {Clare}used to visit the mound and wrote _ "still I hear the clacking mill, and the river's running under the trysting tree". At the centre of the village the church enjoys a commanding position. Its{fine tower (13th century)}can be seen for miles around. The village has many other fine old buildings built between 1600 and 1750. These together with some lovely stone cottages marks it out as{a conservation area.
